article_title: NY Archdiocese Asks 2nd Circ. To Curb Birth Control Mandate
article_text:
NY Archdiocese Asks 2nd Circ. To Curb Birth Control Mandate

Law360, New York (October 2, 2014, 5:57 PM ET) -- The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York and several schools and health care providers have asked the Second Circuit to uphold a decision that religious groups don’t need to comply with the Affordable Care Act’s contraception mandate, arguing the act’s opt-out accommodation still violates their religious beliefs.



Opting-out of the contraception mandate triggers contraception coverage through a third party, making them complicit in facilitating immoral conduct by ensuring contraception is made available, the archdiocese said. In the wake of the Supreme Court’s Hobby Lobby decision, similar...
